ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: G2.Have you been feeling worried or nervous in the past week?

ElementDescription: "G2.(If Yes): Whats been making you feel nervous (worried, uncalm, unrelaxed)?"

ElementDescription: G2.Do you get into a state of panic?

ElementDescription: "G2.Has your sleep, eating, or participation in activities been affected?"
Notes: Not necessary if No at panss_1

ElementDescription: G2.For participation: How many times has anxiety disrupted your participation in activities this past week?
Notes: Not necessary if No at panss_1

"G10.Series 7 (starting at 100, backwards by 7s)"
Notes: "1=correct; 2=incorrect, Respondent must count backwards from 100 in increments of 7, if this is successful = CORRECT, if not = INCORRECT"

ElementDescription: G10.IF INCORRECT: Series 3 (starting at 100)
Notes: "1=correct; 2=incorrect, Not necessary if correct at panss_175 ; Respondent must count backwards from 100 in increments of 3, if this is successful = CORRECT, if not = INCORRECT"

ElementDescription: "N5.Im going to now say a pair of words...How are they alike---what do they have in common?(CHOOSES ONE OF: 1.How are a ball and an orange alike?, 2.Apple and banana?, 3.Pencil and pen?, 4.Nickel and dime?)"
Notes: "1=correct; 2=incorrect,"

ElementDescription: N5.Section 1 Similarities Used
Notes: "1=How are a ball and an orange alike?;2=Apple and banana?;3=Pencil and pen?;4=Nickel and dime?. The interviewer will circle the item pair used, the codes correspond to each of the options. "

DELUSIONS-Beliefs which are unfounded, unrealistic and idiosyncratic. Basis for rating: Thought content expressed in the interview and its influence on social relations and behavior.
Notes: 1 = Absent; 2 = Minimal; 3 = Mild; 4 = Moderate; 5 = Moderate Severe; 6 = Severe; 7 = Extreme; -999 = Missing; -2 = Not collected at this time point; -5 = Item/Instrument not collected; -8 = Unknown

ElementDescription: CONCEPTUAL DISORGANIZATION: Disorganized process of thinking characterized by disruption of goal-directed sequencing, e.g., circumstantiality, loose associations, tangentiality, gross illogicality or thought block. Basis for rating: Cognitive-verbal processes observed during the course of interview.
Notes: 1 = Absent; 2 = Minimal; 3 = Mild; 4 = Moderate; 5 = Moderate Severe; 6 = Severe; 7 = Extreme; -999 = Missing; -2 = Not collected at this time point; -5 = Item/Instrument not collected; -8 = Unknown

ElementDescription: HALLUCINATORY BEHAVIOR: Verbal report or behavior indicating perceptions which are not generated by external stimuli. These may occur in the auditory, visual, olfactory or somatic realms. Basis for rating: Verbal report and physical manifectations during the course of interview as well as reports of behavior by primary care workers or family.
Notes: 1 = Absent; 2 = Minimal; 3 = Mild; 4 = Moderate; 5 = Moderate Severe; 6 = Severe; 7 = Extreme; -999 = Missing; -2 = Not collected at this time point; -5 = Item/Instrument not collected; -8 = Unknown

ElementDescription: EXCITEMENT: Hyperactivity as reflected in accelerated motor behavior, heightened responsivity to stimuli, hypervigilance or excessive mood lability. Basis for rating: Behavioral manifestations during the course of interview as well as reports of behavior by primary care workers or family.
Notes: 1 = Absent;2 = Minimal;3 = Mild;4 = Moderate;5 = Moderate Severe;6 = Severe;7 = Extreme; -999 = Missing

ElementDescription: GRANDIOSITY: Exaggerated self-opinion and unrealistic convictions of superiority, including delusions of extraordinary abilities, wealth, knowledge, fame, power, and moral righteousness. Basis for rating: Thought content expressed in the interview and its influence on behavior.
Notes: 1 = Absent;2 = Minimal;3 = Mild;4 = Moderate;5 = Moderate Severe;6 = Severe;7 = Extreme; -999 = Missing

ElementDescription: SUSPICIOUSNESS/PERSECUTION: Unrealistic or exaggerated ideas of persecution, as reflected in guardedness, ad distrustful attitude, suspicious hypervigilance or frank delusions that others mean harm. Basis for rating: Thought content expressed in the interview and its influence on behavior.
Notes: 1 = Absent;2 = Minimal;3 = Mild;4 = Moderate;5 = Moderate Severe;6 = Severe;7 = Extreme; -999 = Missing

ElementDescription: HOSTILITY: Verbal and nonverbal expressions of anger and resentment, including sarcasm, passive-aggressive behavior, verbal abuse, and assaultiveness. Basis for rating: interpersonal behavior observed during the interview and reports by primary care workers or family.
Notes: 1 = Absent;2 = Minimal;3 = Mild;4 = Moderate;5 = Moderate Severe;6 = Severe;7 = Extreme; -999 = Missing

ElementDescription: BLUNTED AFFECT: Diminished emotional responsiveness as characterized by a reduction in facial expression, modulation of feelings and communicative gestures. Basis for rating: Observation of physical manifestations of affective tone and emotional responsiveness during the course of the interview.
Notes: 1 = Absent; 2 = Minimal; 3 = Mild; 4 = Moderate; 5 = Moderate Severe; 6 = Severe; 7 = Extreme; -999 = Missing; -2 = Not collected at this time point; -5 = Item/Instrument not collected; -8 = Unknown

ElementDescription: EMOTIONAL WITHDRAWAL: Lack of interest in, involvement with, and affective commitment to lifes events. Basis for rating: Reports of functioning from primary care workers or family and observation of interpersonal behavior during the course of the interview.
Notes: 1 = Absent;2 = Minimal;3 = Mild;4 = Moderate;5 = Moderate Severe;6 = Severe;7 = Extreme; -999 = Missing

ElementDescription: POOR RAPPORT: Lack of interpersonal empathy, openness in conversation and sense of closeness, interest or involvement with the interviewer. This is evidenced by interpersonal distancing and reduced verbal and nonverbal communication. Basis for rating: Interpersonal behavior during the course of the interview.
Notes: 1 = Absent;2 = Minimal;3 = Mild;4 = Moderate;5 = Moderate Severe;6 = Severe;7 = Extreme; -999 = Missing

ElementDescription: PASSIVE/APATHETIC SOCIAL WITHDRAWAL: Diminished interest and initiative in social interactions due to passivity, apathy, anergy or avolition. This leads to reduced interpersonal involvements and neglect of activities of daily living. Basis for rating: Reports on social behavior from primary care workers or family.
Notes: 1 = Absent; 2 = Minimal; 3 = Mild; 4 = Moderate; 5 = Moderate Severe; 6 = Severe; 7 = Extreme; -999 = Missing; -2 = Not collected at this time point; -5 = Item/Instrument not collected; -8 = Unknown

ElementDescription: DIFFICULTY IN ABSTRACT THINKING: Impairment in the use of the abstract-symbolic mode of thinking, as evidenced by difficulty in classification, forming generalizations and proceeding beyond concrete or egocentric thinking in problem-solving tasks. Basis for rating: Responses to questions on similarities and proverb interpretation, and use of concrete vs. abstract mode during the course of the interview.
Notes: 1 = Absent;2 = Minimal;3 = Mild;4 = Moderate;5 = Moderate Severe;6 = Severe;7 = Extreme; -999 = Missing

ElementDescription: LACK OF SPONTANEITY AND FLOW OF CONVERSATION: Reduction in the normal flow of communication associated with apathy, avolition, defensiveness or cognitive deficit. This is manifested by diminished fluidity and productivity of the verbal interactional process. Basis for rating: Cognitive-verbal processes observed during the course of interview.
Notes: 1 = Absent; 2 = Minimal; 3 = Mild; 4 = Moderate; 5 = Moderate Severe; 6 = Severe; 7 = Extreme; -999 = Missing; -2 = Not collected at this time point; -5 = Item/Instrument not collected; -8 = Unknown

ElementDescription: STEREOTYPED THINKING: Decreased fluidity, spontaneity and flexibility of thinking, as evidenced in rigid, repetitious or barren thought content. Basis for rating: Cognitive: verbal processes observed during the interview.
Notes: 1 = Absent;2 = Minimal;3 = Mild;4 = Moderate;5 = Moderate Severe;6 = Severe;7 = Extreme; -999 = Missing

ElementDescription: SOMATIC CONCERN: Physical complaints or beliefs about bodily illness or malfunctions. This may range from a vague sense of ill being to clear-cut delusions of catastrophic physical disease. Basis for rating: Thought content expressed in the interview.
Notes: 1 = Absent;2 = Minimal;3 = Mild;4 = Moderate;5 = Moderate Severe;6 = Severe;7 = Extreme; -999 = Missing

ElementDescription: ANXIETY: Subjective experience of nervousness, worry, apprehension or restlessness, ranging from excessive concern about the present or future to feelings of panic. Basis for rating: Verbal report during the course of interview and corresponding physical manifestations.
Notes: 1 = Absent;2 = Minimal;3 = Mild;4 = Moderate;5 = Moderate Severe;6 = Severe;7 = Extreme; -999 = Missing

ElementDescription: GUILT FEELINGS: Sense of remorse or self-blame for real or imagined misdeeds in the past. Basis for rating: Verbal report of guilt feelings during the course of interview and the influence on attitudes and thoughts.
Notes: 1 = Absent;2 = Minimal;3 = Mild;4 = Moderate;5 = Moderate Severe;6 = Severe;7 = Extreme; -999 = Missing

ElementDescription: TENSION: Overt physical manifestations of fear, anxiety, and agitation, such as stiffness, tremor, profuse sweating and restlessness. Basis for rating: Verbal report attesting to anxiety and thereupon the severity of physical manifestations of tension observed during the interview.
Notes: 1 = Absent;2 = Minimal;3 = Mild;4 = Moderate;5 = Moderate Severe;6 = Severe;7 = Extreme; -999 = Missing

ElementDescription: MANNERISMS AND POSTURING: Unnatural movements or posture as characterized by an awkward, stilted, disorganized, or bizarre appearance. Basis for rating: Observation of physical manifestations during the course of interview as well as reports from primary care workers or family.
Notes: 1 = Absent;2 = Minimal;3 = Mild;4 = Moderate;5 = Moderate Severe;6 = Severe;7 = Extreme; -999 = Missing

ElementDescription: DEPRESSION: Feelings of sadness, discouragement, helplessness and pessimism. Basis for rating: Verbal report of depressed mood during the course of interview and its observed influence on attitude and behavior.
Notes: 1 = Absent;2 = Minimal;3 = Mild;4 = Moderate;5 = Moderate Severe;6 = Severe;7 = Extreme; -999 = Missing

ElementDescription: MOTOR RETARDATION: Reduction in motor activity as reflected in slowing or lessening or movements and speech, diminished responsiveness of stimuli, and reduced body tone. Basis for rating: Manifestations during the course of interview as well as reports by primary care workers as well as family.
Notes: 1 = Absent;2 = Minimal;3 = Mild;4 = Moderate;5 = Moderate Severe;6 = Severe;7 = Extreme; -999 = Missing

ElementDescription: UNCOOPERATIVENESS: Active refusal to comply with the will of significant others, including the interviewer, hospital staff or family, which may be associated with distrust, defensiveness, stubbornness, negativism, rejection of authority, hostility, or belligerence. Basis for rating:
Notes: 1 = Absent;2 = Minimal;3 = Mild;4 = Moderate;5 = Moderate Severe;6 = Severe;7 = Extreme; -999 = Missing

ElementDescription: UNUSUAL THOUGHT CONTENT: Thinking characterized by strange, fantastic or bizarre ideas, ranging from those which are remote or atypical to those which are distorted, illogical and patently absurd. Basis for rating: Thought content expressed during the course of interview.
Notes: 1 = Absent;2 = Minimal;3 = Mild;4 = Moderate;5 = Moderate Severe;6 = Severe;7 = Extreme; -999 = Missing

ElementDescription: DISORIENTATION: Lack of awareness of ones relationship to the milieu, including persons, place and time, which may be due to confusion or withdrawal. Basis for rating: Responses to interview questions on orientation.
Notes: 1 = Absent;2 = Minimal;3 = Mild;4 = Moderate;5 = Moderate Severe;6 = Severe;7 = Extreme; -999 = Missing

ElementDescription: POOR ATTENTION: Failure in focused alertness manifested by poor concentration, distractibility from internal and external stimuli, and difficulty in harnessing, sustaining or shifting focus to new stimuli. Basis for rating: Manifestations during the course of interview.
Notes: 1 = Absent;2 = Minimal;3 = Mild;4 = Moderate;5 = Moderate Severe;6 = Severe;7 = Extreme; -999 = Missing

ElementDescription: LACK OF JUDGEMENT AND INSIGHT: Impaired awareness or understanding of ones own psychiatric condition and life situation. This is evidenced by failure to recognize past or present psychiatric illness or sumptoms, denial of need for psychiatric hospitalization or treatment, decisions characterized by poor anticipation or consequences, and unrealistic short-term and long-range planning. Basis for rating: Thought content expressed during the interview.
Notes: 1 = Absent;2 = Minimal;3 = Mild;4 = Moderate;5 = Moderate Severe;6 = Severe;7 = Extreme; -999 = Missing

ElementDescription: DISTURBANCE OF VOLITION: Disturbance in the willful initiation, sustenance and control of ones thoughts, behavior, movements and speech. Basis for rating: Thought content and behavior manifested in the course of interview.
Notes: 1 = Absent;2 = Minimal;3 = Mild;4 = Moderate;5 = Moderate Severe;6 = Severe;7 = Extreme; -999 = Missing

ElementDescription: POOR IMPULSE CONTROL: Disordered regulation and control of action on inner urges, resulting in sudden, unmodulated, arbitrary or misdirected discharge of tension and emotions without concern about consequences. Basis for rating: Behavior during the course of interview and reportted by primary care workers or family.
Notes: 1 = Absent;2 = Minimal;3 = Mild;4 = Moderate;5 = Moderate Severe;6 = Severe;7 = Extreme; -999 = Missing

ElementDescription: PREOCCUPATION: Absorption with internally generated thoughts and feelings and with autistic experiences to the detriment of reality orientation and adaptive behavior. Basis for rating: Interpersonal behavior observed during the course of interview.
Notes: 1 = Absent;2 = Minimal;3 = Mild;4 = Moderate;5 = Moderate Severe;6 = Severe;7 = Extreme; -999 = Missing

ElementDescription: ACTIVE SOCIAL AVOIDANCE: Deminished social involvement associated with unwarranted fear, hostility, or distrust. Basis for rating: Reports of social functioning primary care workers or family.
Notes: 1 = Absent;2 = Minimal;3 = Mild;4 = Moderate;5 = Moderate Severe;6 = Severe;7 = Extreme; -999 = Missing

Sequence Number
Notes:
The FSEQNO variable in the ADJ form has a special interpretation compared to other forms.
For example, ADJ FSEQNO of '1' can be thought of as being '001', FSEQNO of '2' can be thought of as
being '002', and FSEQNO of '3' can be thought of as being '003'.
The first digit of FSEQNO relates to the corresponding ENF sequence number at that visit and the third
digit relates to the specific adjudicator who completed the adjudication form.

ElementDescription: In the specified time, have you (or your relative) been acting as if you have special powers/abilities, or are a great person in society?
Notes: 0= Not At All; 1= Once; 2= Few Times; 3= Often; 4= Continuously

ElementDescription: In the specified time, have you (or your relative) felt that people wanted to hurt you (by poisoning food or water), people were talking about you, broadcasts on the radio or TV were about you, that others were trying to control you, but other people do not believe you?
Notes: 0= Not At All; 1= Once; 2= Few Times; 3= Often; 4= Continuously

ElementDescription: In the specified time, have you (or your relative) felt angry often, had thoughts of wanting to hurt people, or threatened other people with violence?
Notes: 0= Not At All; 1= Once; 2= Few Times; 3= Often; 4= Continuously

ElementDescription: In the specified time, have you (or your relative) heard from other people that you look distant, unengaged?
Notes: 0= Not At All; 1= Once; 2= Few Times; 3= Often; 4= Continuously

ElementDescription: In the specified time, have you (or your relative) felt like you didn?t feel the same way as people around you (e.g. you were not happy at times when they were happy, or you were not sad at times when they were sad?
Notes: 0= Not At All; 1= Once; 2= Few Times; 3= Often; 4= Continuously

ElementDescription: In the specified time, have you (or your relative) found it difficult to make friends and maintain old friendships, OR do you find it difficult to make small talk with people?
Notes: 0= Not At All; 1= Once; 2= Few Times; 3= Often; 4= Continuously

ElementDescription: In the specified time, have you (or your relative) had a lack of interest in doing things with other people?
Notes: 0= Not At All; 1= Once; 2= Few Times; 3= Often; 4= Continuously

ElementDescription: In the specified time, have you (or your relative) had difficulty understanding familiar sayings, or learning new ideas?
Notes: 0= Not At All; 1= Once; 2= Few Times; 3= Often; 4= Continuously

ElementDescription: In the specified time, have you (or your relative) been speaking rarely or responded with only yes, no, I do not know to questions?
Notes: 0= Not At All; 1= Once; 2= Few Times; 3= Often; 4= Continuously

ElementDescription: In the specified time, have you (or your relative) been thinking and talking about the same thing over and over?
Notes: 0= Not At All; 1= Once; 2= Few Times; 3= Often; 4= Continuously

ElementDescription: Have you ever had periods where you heard voices of someone or people whom others could not see or hear?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes

ElementDescription: Have you ever felt that someone was trying to hurt you or follow you but others kept telling you that no one was there or no one was trying to hurt you?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes

ElementDescription: Have you ever had periods where you behaved in a way that did not make sense to others or scared others, for example, not eating or dressing appropriately, wandering around for no reason, jumping in the bush, or threatening others even though you did not have a quarrel with them?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes

ElementDescription: In the specified time, did you (or your relative) feel implausible things were happening to you, such as having some kind of physical illness or that your organs were decaying (no issue during medical checks), or feeling that you had insects or electricity crawling inside of you?
Notes: 0= Not At All; 1= Once; 2= Few Times; 3= Often; 4= Continuously

ElementDescription: In the specified time, did you (or your relative) speak about things and ideas that other people did not understand?
Notes: 0= Not At All; 1= Once; 2= Few Times; 3= Often; 4= Continuously

ElementDescription: In the specified time, did you (or your relative) hear voices that other people did not hear or voices telling you to do things even when other people were not around or did you see things that other people said they could not see?
Notes: 0= Not At All; 1= Once; 2= Few Times; 3= Often; 4= Continuously

ElementDescription: In the specified time, have you (or your relative) felt happy and energetic for no reason?
Notes: 0= Not At All; 1= Once; 2= Few Times; 3= Often; 4= Continuously

Notes: Sum of pos_p1, pos_p2, pos_p3, neg_n1, neg_n4, neg_n6; -9 = Missing; -2 = Not collected at this time point; -5 = Item/Instrument not collected; -8 = Unknown

Notes: e.g., Baseline, Morning, At Bedtime
